result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus J Preuss was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Marcus J Preuss is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Marcus J Preuss was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: BTC: $50/mo payment plan commencing May 17, 2016 w/$15 PPF added-Defendant agreed
75 Days in Marquette County Jail w/huber; consecutive to any other sentence; Report on or before April 15, 2016by 7:00 pm, clean and sober; May serve in Columbia County; Credit 2 Days

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus J Preuss

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: MARQUETTE COUNTY DNA PROOF OF SUBMISSION

Defendant Marcus J Preuss in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.  Atty Gumz agrees.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.

Atty Hendee asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments and asks the court to follow the recommendation.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 1:  Court orders 75 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; consecutive to any other sentece
  Report on or before April 15, 2016 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
Credit = 2 days
May serve in Columbia County
Court Costs = $243.00
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing in May

Defendant Marcus J Preuss in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states that the defendant has a case pending in Columbia County and asks the court to reset for Plea.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Plea
bond continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 17, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Marcus J Preuss in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that there has been some discussion however the parties are asking for a reset.  Atty Gumz agrees.

BY THE COURT:  Reset.
Bond continued.  Return date scheduled for February 4, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Gumz states that the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Gumz states that the defendant is in Columbia County Jail.  Atty Gumz needs time to file an authorization.
  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Court finds probable cause.
Set for Return
Court gives 30 days for Atty Gumz to file an authorization.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
